Luckily, with some help, I was able to get it zipped and it fit perfectly!  I tried on the smaller of the two sizes I received but it was a little tighter than I would like for a full night event.  I suggest large earrings and a bangle type bracelet.  The dress doesn't really need a necklace because it cuts up high.  This is my second time with renting a dress and I am still impressed with the customer service, quality of product, and amount of compliments I receive.  Thanks RTR!
The dress runs small so size up! It's very snug and form fitting. Nothing to hide in this dress! But I loved it!
Wore it over a featherweight longsleeve, perfect length and fit in the neck/shoulders.  Super soft.  Looks best a little asymmetrical, like the model.  Definitely getting this again!!

The dress was a little big in the bust. I had to use body tape all around my chest and back to hold it up. It fit perfectly everywhere else, and was the perfect length for me. I am 5'6" tall and wore two inch heels. Highly recommend!

I loved the dress but here are all the details.
Fabric: Thick, double layered so good for colder months and flattering.
Fit: Runs true to size, flattering and comfortable so room to have dinner if ya know what I mean.
Style: This has a classic look with the cap sleeve, but do not be mistaken.... this dress is a bit scandalous.  It is not just a deep V as many review it... it is a wide V.  Think one quick turn away from a nip slip V.  Having said that the fabric is thick and stays in place as I did not have any issues and did not use tape or anything.
I would do this again, but make sure it's the right event (i.e. not work appropriate!).  ENJOY

I wore this dress for a wedding rehearsal in Mexico and was perfectly appropriate for this more casual event. The dress fit like a glove - the material had some stretch and was thick enough to be forgiving. Unlike other strapless dresses I've worn in the past, I didn't have to tug up the top more than a few times throughout the evening. I loved the length and the slit was sexy, but not too high. The color was very pretty and I paired it with really sexy red heels, though it could probably go well with any number of colors.
I liked the fit a lot but fabric wrinkles easily. Overall it was a great blazer and it totally made my outfit. I folded the sleeves so no one would notice the missing buttons! 😬

These were really fun pants! I wore them for dinner and cocktails and more casually during the day with leather Vince sneakers. Nice silk material that isn't too thin and drapes nicely. Definitely comfortable. They did run a touch small. I'm between an 8 and a 10 usually and got these in a Large; they fit perfectly in the thighs and butt (where I usually have issues) but were a bit tight in the waist. Not too bad but if you're on the higher end of your usual size I would recommend sizing up.

This was my backup dress.  One of my girls didn't have a dress to wear at my bachelorette so I let her wear it.  She looked so beautiful and she told me she felt great.  The length and neckline were really comfortable.  She's the same height, size and build as me.  She wore a pair of my black Michael Kohrs heels with a black coach clutch.  Perfect for a bachelorette!

I went a size down on this dress and it fit perfectly. Not too tight, but was form fitting. I got compliments all night at the party we attended on the length and fit. The color was a nice red just like in the photo. I would definitely wear again.
The dress was very long, so make sure you wear HIGH heels!

This dress is super flattering and I got lots of compliments on it. The material is pretty thick, but I wore it to an end-of-June wedding and was totally comfortable. Like many others have said, it's more of a sparkly gray than a black. The material is also fairly stretchy; I'd say size down for your back-up size.

I'm petite so this dress worked for me, a taller woman with a longer torso will be displaying her assets maybe a little too much in this dress!  Even on me, the sheer area was a little higher in the back than I would have liked...but maybe that's why it felt fun?  I wore a nude spanx short to conceal my tush which worked great.

The fit was true to size, hugged the body in all the perfect ways. Yes the sequin can be a bit itchy under the arms, but you quickly get use to it. I ordered a 6L due to the reviews on length and I wish I had ordered regular. I'm 5'5 and wore Christian Louboutin Lady Peeps (5+ inches) and the dress was still a bit too long. Fabulous dress, perfect for formal affair and it photographs amazingly!

Out of the bag, this dress is unimpressive. My elementary-aged daughter thought it was a "santa sack" lying on my bed. And my husband, not knowing that she commented thus, said "ho ho ho" when I tried it on. For these reasons I almost didn't wear it.

BUT I'M SO SO GLAD I DID.

This dress is stunning yet simple. Flattering yet comfortable. It really sets the stage for your lovely face to take the limelight. 

Do be aware that it is SHORT. Perfect for me at barely 5'3", but I'm not sure how you'd sit modestly if you're tall ... Sharon Stone? I'd suggest going up a size if you're big in the bust or wide in the hips.

I loved this dress! The fit was so flattering and slimming. I wore my typical size and it was perfect even though the fabric has no stretch. The dress is definitely appropriate for a formal dinner or party, but could be dressed down. At 5'5", it was a bit longer on me than on the model, hitting at my knee. I'd pair this dress with black heels and silver jewelry.

I was fairly disappointed by this dress.  I am a very consistent 4 but this dress was HUGE on me and didn't fit my waist at all, so much so that I ended up wearing my back up RTR dress instead.  I was also surprised by the material, it was very heavy and thick and had a train on the back that I wasn't expecting.  The long was way too long on me, even with my highest heels, but since I was working at my non-profit's black tie gala that night I knew the train wouldn't work and someone was going to step on the back of it.  Overall, I still love the ruffle on the shoulder, but it's just not built for girls with any hips that don't want to look like tents.
This dress was everything and more than I had hoped for. I wore it for a charity Masquerade Ball.

Probably my favorite thing I've rented from RTR and it just fits so perfectly. Literally got compliments on it all night so decided I'm gonna hold on to it for a little bit...sorry ladies!! Xox if you can find in your size DOOOO it

This was a beautiful dress and I loved wearing it. It is tight on top and at the waist, so if you have a small chest the sizing shouldn't be an issue. The only downside was that the hem came undone towards the end of the night, so I found myself tripping on the bottom of the dress. Overall, this is a gorgeous and really fun to wear dress!
I liked the slim, drop-waisted cut of this dress!  The length was work-appropriate; the v-neck less so.  One of my best Unlimited rentals yet.
This dress is very cute and fun for work. The material is stretchy and comfortable. The detail on the top is really pretty. It is a little shorter than I was expecting.

Skirt runs large.  Size down 1 (or 2 for high waisted).  The skirt will add volume and unfortunately there is no eye clasp on the top - so all that keeps it on is the zipper. 

The colors were a bit worn out from wears - white was not very bright (more creamy) and the black was not vibrant.  Overall, cute statement piece, fit leaves a bit to be desired.

Wore with a standard strapless bra.  If I rent again, I will go down one size.  The straps were a little bit long, and so my hubby tied little knots at the top of the straps to shorten them.  Luckily my hair hid the knots.  This shirt can be dressed up or down, and I felt really great in it.  I wore it over 4th of July weekend, and the red, white and blue colors were great....but, I'd wear it anytime.

The dress style might work better for somebody taller. I was 8 weeks pregnant when I wore this dress, and so how a little bump, so the twist in the front made me look a little bigger than I actually am. The back is beautiful. While I ended up wearing it, I wasn't as confident as I have been in other rentals. I'm 5'2" and the Petite length fit, but I wore short heels. If you are wearing taller heels, I would recommend the regular length.
Wish I could own this jumper, I felt great in it and got compliments from strangers on the street.  The S was perfect on me, more on the loose side. Super confortable!
I wore this dress to a New Years Eve party. It was comfortable (thick, semi-stretchy material) and flattering (but not too tight). The length was perfect for me, but I'm 5'1". Would rent again!
It was kind of big around the bust area. Could have been tighter, but the length and fit around the waist was perfect! Loved wearing this!

This dress isn't for someone who is afraid to show a little skin. The straps essentially stay on your body from your boobs. It's low cut in the front (and in the back.) That being said, it shows off skin in all of the right places. The top does run in a little small in the rib cage area, so if you don't have a smaller waist or chest, I would advise sizing up one size. I got the long and wore 2.5" heels, and it was the perfect length on me (I'm almost 6 foot.) I definitely recommend this dress for any summer event. The color is stunning.

Since there isn't a lot of stretch in the bodice apparently, I opted to order the size 4 and it worked out perfectly. I love the off shoulder look even though you can't really raise your hands so this is probably a dress you'd want to rent for a date not a going out dancing kind of look. The details on the skirt are a lot more noticeable in person as well.

I usually wear a size 4 but this dress was too large. The size 2 was unavailable, but I think it would have worked well. Sorry I didn't get the chance to wear it but I would order it again in the smaller size.
They were out of a size 4 which I think would have fit perfectly, the top on the 6 was a tad big for me but doublestick tape made it work just fine!

Loved this dress!  I wore it to a super casual backyard bbq wedding and got so many compliments on it!  The dress in the hips/thighs was a little more fitted than I expected, so I wore the large instead of the medium for a little more flow/roomy fit for dancing.  The medium fit me perfectly, but was missing the belt and I was looking for a little bit more flow in the dress in the thigh area for dancing and such, so I wore the large which still fit great!  A lot of reviews also talked about the clasp in the bust coming undone which I had pop open twice on the dance floor with some crazy moves, but other than that no issues with the clasp coming undone.  I feel though if I chose to wear the medium for a more fitted look, I would have had to pin that clasp like many others had done.  The straps of the dress are also adjustable which was also great to tighten or loosen to help get the perfect fit of the dress.  The dress was a good length as well, I was a little worried it was going to be too short since I'm 5'9", but I wasn't constantly tugging it down or worried about it riding up.

The dress did run a little large and long, but I bought the 'stick em up' tapes and they were fantastic!  I've never worn a strapless dress that I didn't have to pull up every 5 minutes -- until now.  The tapes worked very well and my dress stayed in the right place all night!  The dress was little long but I wore tall shoes and made it work.  The experience was easy and the dress was fantastic!  I wore it to a New Years Eve party at the Kennedy Center in DC and the red definitely stood out among a sea of dark colors.  I got lots of compliments and can't wait to RTR again!
The fit was perfect and felt like it was designed for my body. I received so many compliments at the wedding we attended. I would highly recommend this dress.

I loved the fit of this dress and the color! I felt like a showstopper and got tons of compliments all night long. 

I am 5 foot 3, so I went ahead and ordered the petite size just in case it was too long. Like the comments suggest, the dress does run short. I only wore 1.5 inch heels so that the dress was the correct length. I have long legs for my height, but a short torso. The torso on my size 14P was a tad too long, but the size 12P was just a little to tight to wear dancing all night. Because the dress has boning in the torso and my torso is short, I did find that the dress started digging into my hip part way through the evening. The sequins did not bother my arms, but I took another renter's advise and used Body Glide... highly recommend it!  

I would rent it again in a heartbeat!!!
Go for the long size, regular is too short if you gonna wear at least 4 inches heels.
Very comfortable but sheerer than I had thought it would be.  Wore it twice :)

The dress is more pink than it appears in the picture.   It is definitely short for someone 5'9''.  I couldn't have gone any shorter and still be respectable.  Iloved the dress and the pattern for a daytime spring wedding.
It fit perfectly. The color really stood out!

This was the perfect dress to wear for my 30th birthday.  There's a bit of stretch to the material, especially in the lower half of the dress so it hugs your curves in the right places.  The arms are a little tight and I'm pretty lean in that area so that's something to consider.  Several reviews mentioned not being able to wear a bra with it, but I wore a convertible low back bra and didn't have any troubles with it the entire evening.  The sequins are a little scratchy if you rub up against anyone, but they weren't a bother to me because it was lined well.

I loved wearing this pantsuit at a formal event. It was elegant, classy, and flattering. The 0R was overall a bit baggy/longer on me, so I pinned it up a bit at the shoulders, and it was perfect. Definitely recommend this piece!

Loved this dress. The lining was a little longer than the dress but it was easy to put it up with double sided tape. The dress was super flattering and the color blocking helped give an illusion of a smaller waist, I thought. Great colors and the dress showed off my legs well but wasn't too short! I will definitely rent it again!

My husband said it looked weird when I first tried it on, but the second day said it looked better.  I think this just isn't the best dress for someone curvy on top.  There wasn't a lot of room unless you're pretty flat chested.  I loved the sleeves and the warmth of this great fall dress.

I was sent this dress as a back up for the dress I had truly wanted. I ended up wearing this one because of how flattering the cut was. The colors were very pretty and I keep getting compliments on the pictures from the occasion. The dress was rather comfortable but be careful because the only bra I was able to find that worked was the kind that sticks on and laces up the middle... even the normal stick on bra showed on the sides. Either way, I'm glad I had this dress!

This was the first jumpsuit that I ever wore and it was a great experience. I recommend wearing a size larger than normal because the torso portion is a little short and I felt it tugged on my shoulders a bit. IT was difficult to bend over in it. But I was able to sit and dance just fine. I got lots of compliments - definitely makes me want to wear it again.
Wore this for my rehearsal dinner. Absolutely loved it. Just the right amount of sparkle and fits well in all the right places.
Loved the color.  Lots of compliments

I wore this for my informal, tiny wedding ceremony outdoors on a rainy northern CA winter's morning (<50 degrees F). The dress went perfectly with boots, tights, and a flowy cardigan (although I had to pin it behind or else it looked boxy over the poufy skirt). I am 5'5" with a short torso and a relatively straight waist-hip ratio, and the flared skirt made me feel feminine. I usually wear a 4, and I thought that fit fine. Then I tried on the 2, which I ordered based on reviews saying to size down, and I liked how it gave a more defined shape. I wore the 2 for the ceremony but ended up changing into the 4 after a large meal. If this dress were available for sale, I wouldn't hesitate to buy it (in a size 4). If you have a tiny waist, you may be happy sizing down to the 2 or even 0. However, on me, my thicker waist made the waistline of the dress ride up higher and it didn't look good to size down too much. I also rented the version of this dress with the blue flowers, and they fit a bit differently. The arm holes of the blue were a tiny bit closer-set and showed my bra straps, and the fabric was thinner. This dress with the white and peach flowers had slightly thicker fabric and a more flared skirt. By the way, it is *not* neoprene like a wetsuit - it's more of a smooth ponte material. It did show the seams of my bra a bit. The exposed zipper didn't bother me at all.

I love this dress!  The XS fit me great, although it was ALMOST too snug in the hip area.  I typically wear a size 4 jeans, and I have a booty.  I wore spanx and it worked fine.  Size up if you like a looser fit. Also, you can wear a regular bra with this, but it is a bit sheer.  The front sheer part layed a bit low on me, and you could see the top outline of my bra.  It wasn't too bad, so I wore it anyway.  I'm short, 5'1", so if you are taller you won't have that problem.  Gorgeous color, looks great with black tights and stiletto-heeled booties.  I also wore this with a long gold chain necklace and taupe clutch.  :)
I went with the Long because I like formal dresses to skirt the floor. I wore 3" heels, and the length was perfect.
dazzles

Huge fan of this jumpsuit! I don't recommend it for someone too tall, as it may ride up in the front too much. I was able to wear a low cut standard bra, and it peaked out on the top a bit, but it looked like it could have been a part of the jumpsuit. The jumpsuit is great with heels or wedges, and looks like a dress. I recommend sizing up if you are fuller busted, or have a tummy! Super cute with the tie around the waist and  in the front. A very cool style!

I wore this to my company's black tie holiday party, and the dress was really gorgeous.  It hugged my curves nicely and had just enough of a train in the back to look really special. The color was a bit darker than it looked in pictures, more of a gunmetal grey than a metallic silver, but it was definitely beautiful! It does run long though - I'm 5'4" and even with 4 inch heels on, the dress still dragged on the floor. I received complements all night!
was a little big on me, but the open back made it less noticeable - with the lack of stretch/give to the lace, i was probably better off with a slightly bigger size anyways
The 4L was perfect for my height wearing 3 inch heels. The rest of the dress fit me like a glove. Received many compliments on it.
Perfect in everyway and got so many complements.
The full skirt was not the most flattering fit on me.

I ordered the ML for my birthday dinner with my parents but was disappointed when it arrived. The color was beautiful but the fit was horrible. I am 5'11", with long limbs. The ML fit fine in the body but the legs and arms were ridiculously short. Rather than running full length, the legs hit about mid calf and the arms, rather than being bracelet length, hit right around my elbow. I question whether I was actually sent the ML since the tag just said M.  I returned it unworn.

I order this dress for a fundraiser my husband and I were attending.  I ended up wearing a different dress I had rented but only because the party was themed "Old Hollywood Glamour" and the other dress had more of a 20's style to it.  However, I would definitely order this dress again for another event.  It was beautiful, it felt great on - fitting snugly but not too tight.  The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is that I did think it was a little short even in the "L" size.

I am the Director of a Local Miss America Affiliated Organization, and I wore this dress for our 2015 Pageant.  It was perfect for the event, and it was very comfortable to wear.  I wish I could have added this to my own personal wardrobe.  PS-it has POCKETS!  That makes any plain dress into an AMAZING dress!

I wore this for my 22nd birthday party. This was my 1st rental from Rent-The-Runway. It fit absolutely perfect. Not too low-cut or short, but just right. RTR makes it so easy to send back. I love this company!

Loved this gorgeous bright cobalt style! From the alluring plunging neckline to the flowing tiered ruffles, it's the perfect spring dress. I usually wear 4 but wore a 6R in this dress and I'd say it runs true to size but with no stretch to the fabric I recommend sizing up for back up especially if you are curvier. I'm a 34B and although I had some room it was still fitted at bust, great for A-C cup sizes and can be worn with any standard bra!  At 5'6 it hit me at tea length and I wore 3" heels. It's great for Hourglass, Athletic, Pear, Petite, Straight & Narrow body types. Pair it with strappy heels and a beautiful necklace to complete your look.
The dress fit perfect, it's very flattering and comfortable. I got many compliments all night

Forgiving fit, nice material.
One thing-Would have liked it they put a hook at the hem to accommodate for the train.

Loved this dress. The lace at the chest was really pretty and the cut is very flattering. There is a small open back but I was able to wear a strapless bra which was great. The dress was very comfortable. I wore the medium, which I would say is pretty true to size, but I could have squeezed into the small if I was not worried about eating/dancing all night. Overall, great rental!

wore this to my son's 1st bday party. fit great, like others have said the neck is a bit tight but i'm petite so wasn't a problem. I'm 5 feet tall about 115 lbs, it kept my post partum belly and slight saddle bags hidden which was nice. FOR SHORT PEOPLE: it is quite long i wore white sandals < 1 inch tall and it almost hit the ground. (see picture). I'm 32D and the boob section was a little loose. if bigger boobs would have fit great. overall great and fun dress, got alot of compliments, would rent again.

The dress is made of a very good quality fabric, nice and thick and forgiving for any lumps. For an outdoor summer wedding it might be too hot. The silhouette is really flattering, making the waist look small while leaving room in the belly area so you can eat/drink without restraint :)  If you're on the shorter side like me, the length is perfect for showing off the legs but if you're taller there may be risk of butt-flashing! When I bent over or had to sit, it felt a little dicey at times.

The material and fitting of this dress are unforgiving. It hugged and highlighted every single detail. I liked the front a lot, but the back felt fabric heavy. Definitely not for my body type; I couldn't wear it.

The dress would have been a bit short if I wouldn't have worn black tights but I absolutely loved the texture (very soft), lining, pockets, and overall fit. It was such an interesting pattern and I got lots of compliments. I would definitely wear this dress again!
Great color, flattering fit, easy to get in and out of when you need to go to the bathroom (very important for a romper) and love the fabric.
The dress fit snugly, a bit tight in the arms but otherwise it was perfect. I need to change my bust size on my profile, they don't have an option for a 38DD!

This dress arrived with a pretty strong odor.  I'm sure like a drycleaning odor or preservative, but it was too strong for me to wear the dress.  The mess neckline is very attractive.  Material is comfortable.  I would recommend it to others based on the fit, but I did not wear it to my event because of the odor.

The dress was pretty. Nothing overly special. It was the perfect shade of true red though, which was great for our Valentines Day announcement photoshoot. The zippers on the sleeves were random and kind of annoying, also the sleeves were a little long on me. I probably could have managed one size down and been more happy.

I had rented this dress before in a M, and it the fit was totally fine. But I decided to rent again in a S, and it was perfect! Absolutely love this dress and how fun it is. It is short and very loose on the bottom, so a windy day will not be your friend. Loved how you didn't have to worry about wearing a bra/bralette. The S fit me much better (I'm a 34C/36Bish). I felt very comfortable!
Runs large was a little baggy in the middle but very comfortable. The arm holes were alittlw big may need to wear a tank under.
Ran a little small. Got endless compliments...should have kept it longer!

I originally ordered the M and L as I am kind of in between sizes.  The L became unavailable the day before, so I had to wear the M.  I am a mom of five kids and I was very afraid that this would be too small, too short and just look awful.  SO WRONG!  This dress, even though smaller than my normal size, was AMAZING.  The bandage style is so form fitting.  I didn't wear spanx or control top anything. Only real downfalls were that I was pulling the bottom down all night as it kept creeping up some and I had to fashion tape the top to make it a little less revealing. (I'm a 36C and it was just a little too much skin showing for me). It was super comfy to dance in, sit in, eat in and walk in.  Looked great with my hubby all night.  Got tons of compliments.
Fit perfectly! There was a little stretch and it was longer/more conservative. I love the lace and it was absolutely perfect for Bingo in Sea Island. Will rent again!
The dress fit perfectly and I received a million compliments on it.

This dress was a tab big on me so I safety pinned the back to make it fit a bit more snuggly. Unfortunately, I didn't receive my backup size (the smaller one that would have fit perfectly) so I went with this. Overall, it wasn't a big deal and once I had it pinned felt secure and comfortable all night. I'm 5'7 and would definitely recommend the Long length. I work short heals and the dress just touched the floor. I was sent the dress in the Regular length and it hit my ankles.

I felt great in this dress!  I usually wear a 6 in dresses but was worried I might have to size up with this designer.  I didn't even have to try on the 8 because the 6 fit perfectly.  My only complaint is that the dress is a little short and the skirt really rides up when sitting down or getting low on the dance floor.
Fits true to size, snug but not tight through the stomach and waist, may want to wear spanx

First, I should have ordered a smaller size. If you're in between, I'd recommend you order down. It has tulle and the skirt has some nice poofing to it. This would have been better for a special occasion than for work.
Love how it adapts to the body. I used it for a formal event during daytime and it was perfect!
I am not a little girl and the 14 W was perfect. I got nothing but compliments ( and free drinks) all evening!

The dress is well-made and very beautiful in person. The color is just right, and the length is nice. Both size 6 and 8 fit almost the same, but I went with the 8. My only issue was that it was tighter on my hips than I had anticipated. I am pear shaped therefore, pretty 'hippy.' If the flare of the skirt had started a few inches higher (or if my torso was longer), I would have loved it. I got compliments, but felt it could have looked better. Also, you could see the line from my tights (see the picture). Overall, my first experience with RTR was a positive one! Very easy.
I have a large chest, no curves, no butt - this made me look like I had curves!  It was conservative enough for a military ball and yet totally sexy.
Could not get any more compliments on a sweater.  Fun to wear to switch up an everyday look.
I'm normally a size 2-4 but the 0 was perfect so get your backup size a size down maybe?  I loved wearing this dress, it was fun to dance in, absolutely perfect for a formal southern wedding!
fit well, comfortable
Easy to put on and wasn't tight at all. Super fun and flirty.

I wore this to dinner and a show in NYC.  It was cool outside so I wore it with some black leggings and short booties.  It was dressed up, but still able to have some character.  I ordered up due to some people's suggestions, and I wished I had tried a size 2, because a 4 was a tad large in the shoulders.  

But all in all I loved the dress!

This dress was beautiful.  the 6 definitely fit me better in the body, but the bust was tight - which wouldn't have been a problem, however it looked like there was a seam running right through the middle of each side of the bust - which meant I had to go up to the 8 which was a bit loose and difficult to find a bra that worked - overall the dress was great and I would definitely recommend it, but if you are a bit out of proportion, like me (larger bust), I would proceed with caution.

I had to wear a very thin bar underneath as it was a little tight for me just in the chest area. But otherwise, the fit was great - especially the cut of the waistline. Usually, I don't like high-waisted dresses, since it makes my short torso looks even more chopped up, but this one was perfect. It also comes with POCKETS, but doesn't make your hips look too wide or add bulk there. Overall, a really great dress that can work well in office and also transition for an evening look.
This dress was AH-MAZING. Wore it to my formal company anniversary party and people almost didn't recognize me. The sheer midriff and sleeves were perfect.
I am a 38DD, this did not work with the girls.
Very girly, tight but forgiving. Runs bit, you can totally go down a size.

I rented this for a gala, and I could not have loved it more!!  It flows when you walk, and the pockets are awesome.  The 6 was a little loose up top, and the 4 was just a bit snug.  The skirt is forgiving, which is wonderful!  I went with the 4 because I was worried I might have to pull up the 6 all night. (4 stayed in place all night!)  The dress is just beautiful, heavy weight fabric, and as others have said, I did have to steam it to get the wrinkles out before the event.  I got compliments from strangers all night.  Loved it, didn't want to send it back!  My first RTR experience, and I will be back!!

I had this dress ordered to the RTR store to try on, and thank goodness I did. As it turns out my actual order for size 2 & 4 in this dress never arrived - but they happened to have the size  on-hand. I was really dissapointed because after trying it on, it just DID NOT FIT. All the reviews I had read stressed how "tight" this dress was. But for me that was not the case. It was falling off of me. I have a pretty small chest (32B), and you could have easily stuffed two padded bras in there - that's how much of a gap in the chest I was dealing with. The two straps in the back are not adjustable, so there was no way for me to make this fit. ALSO, this dress wears much more formal than pictures would have it appear. I am glad I ended up not being able to make this work as it would definitely not have fit in for a bachelorette night on the town. I ended up going with a different dress / style they had in-store.
It definitely does run bigger so caution to the wise.
Perfect for the NYE party I attended, received tons of compliments. It actually looks better in person and is super comfortable.

This was a replacement last minute as my first choice was damaged.  Customer service helped me to figure out sizing, I ordered a 2 and 4..I am typically a 0-2/XS in clothes.  As many have reviewed, the zippers on both are terrible...I was afraid Id break the 4's zipper since it was so stuck, so i went with the 2.  Fabric has a bit of give too..once on its stunning...a very flattering cut although, like others said, I worried the drape of the front made me look hippy.  I had to pin the front since im small chested and it was way too low for me..then it was PERFECT...I loved it so much I wore it the next day at home just to have fun, lol...

Dress fit somewhere between true to size and a little large. I'm 5'1" and it was a little long, slightly below my knee. I also needed to wear a cami underneath because the top was a little low. But the dress looked great and I got a number of compliments on it. I wore it with a black cami underneath and black heels. it was very appropriate for a December temple service.
Wore this to my husband's company Christmas party and it was a hit! Got a ton of compliments, it was super comfortable and festive. One of my favorite rentals so far.

Pros:
SO MUCH SPARKLE 
Makes most figures look great
The fit and cut of the dress was great
Got compliments on it all day
Wow factor X 1000

Cons:
Could get a little hot depending on if you're wearing nylons
If you get a size that's a little too small for you, the arm pit area can feel really scratchy. (I got the M and L size. I expected the M to work and while it fit, it was tight (and scratchy) in the armpit area. The L was perfect for a bit of breathing room without feeling like it was too loose.)

I loved wearing this dress. I got a 4 & 6 - couldn't find a size chart anywhere for AMUR clothing so I went with 2 sizes that almost always work. 
- The fabric is amazing, soft & shimmery, thick enough for nip coverage but light enough for spring/summer. 
- the straps are LONG for my 5'3' self so I safety pinned them an inch shorter 
- I love the length, usually as a shorty that length doesn't work but the bottom is flouncy & flattering
- The size 4 squished my boobs (34D) so I couldn't wear it, went up to size 6 & pinned the straps
- top half probably would work best on someone a little taller or someone very proportionate

The material is nice and thick, so good for a winter party with black tights. It just wasn't anything special. Usually this brand makes really cute silk shift dresses, so we expecting that and then realized it wasn't that material. Good for a winter party, but needs dressy jewelry.
I saw the other reviews that it was big and felt a little boxy, so I sized-down. I'm glad I did this because it felt more fitted to me. I received compliments on this coat all day long. Loved it!

I rented this for my anniversary dinner and at the time, I was between a size 6 and 8. I got both of those sizes, and ended up with the 8. But even the 8 was tight around my ribs. Granted, I do have a wide rib cage, but this dress is definitely runs a bit smaller than others.

My original order was too big (and my back-ups were even bigger), RTR helped me find a perfect back up and I loved it even more than my original choice. I was even stopped a few times by guests at the Plaza who wanted to tell me how gorgeous the dress and color were. The necklace was the mystery bling from my original order and it worked perfectly with this gown. The green is like a deep emerald (for those who are concerned with screen images) and seems to work on all skin types. The dress is super comfortable and light. I guess it runs true to size? I thought I was a 16, but the 16s I ordered were to big and this 14 fit perfectly. My problem area is my stomach and this really helped with that. The zipper was a little difficult bc of the fabric (trying to zip while on the hanger). Bust wise, I'm a 36 D and wore it without a bra. I had a little bit of room, but I'm not sure a bigger bust would've been comfortable. I feel like I should try something different for my next event , but I'm seriously considering just ordering this again since it's a different set of people.
Perfect fit for my 5'4" frame! It was a little long without shoes but with heels it was perfect. It was also super comfortable to sit in, dance in and everything else in between. Highly recommend

I normally wear a 16/18 and rented this dress as a backup in a 14WL.  It was massively huge on me in the waist and chest. I could have put another person in the dress with me. It is not flattering for a pear shaped body and the pleats and tulle underneath make the skirt of the dress stand out.  I was not impressed with the style or color of this dress. The dress reminded me of fishnets.

I rented this dress for a holiday party and absolutley loved it!  The dress was stunning and I received compliments all night.  Ordered my back-up in a size small but didn't even try it on because the medium fit perfectly.  The arms are a bit snug so I would order a back-up size just in case.

This dress fit like a glove!  The scuba material helped suck everything in and added to a very flattering silhouette.  It was also very comfortable to wear.  It was perfect for a cool December evening.

Loved this dress!  Fit really well, was comfortable and flattering.  The bra portion can be adjusted and the buttons up the front could be unbuttoned for a different style.  I'm a 36DD and was comfortable wearing this dress without a bra.  I received a lot of compliments wearing it to a day concert.
The fit was very bad. I did not wear it. The top part was too loose and was not flattering.
I normally wear a size 4 and the dress fit perfectly. I have a fuller bust and rear but a small waist and this dress complemented me well. It was true to size.

So many compliments on this dress! It was super comfortable, but the waist band was tight and ran a little small. I used a safety pin to keep the top from being too revealing. I am 5'8" and wore flat strappy sandals and the length was perfect. I did think it was short for a "long" size but it worked out. Recommended for sure- but I would size up for the waist band.

I was expecting a more tunic-like fit. On me, though not too small, it was more fitted around the hips than I would have anticipated. If anyone is looking for a looser fit, I'd recommend the backup size be one size larger.
fit very well and extremely flattering!
Fit perfectly! The fabric was thick and nicely detailed.

The dress was a bit tight, but did loosen up a little.  I called to order an XL instead of a Large (I wear a 8=10).  The XL was too big in the shoulders.  This fit me well except in the arms.  It was a little tight there.

I LOVED everything about this dress! It was so flattering and comfortable to wear on the dance floor. I wore a regular strapless bra and black shoes (there is some black in the design of the dress). I go between a 6 and an 8 usually and I wore the 8 because the 6 was a bit tight in the bust area. I have never recieved so many compliments. The back of the dress was my favorite part. The upper straps going into the large bow in the back was so unique. It had just the right amount of sparkle without being TOO flashy. I would recommend this dress to anyone!
Fit great, was comfortable, got tons of compliments!
I am 15, 5'7'' , and 109 lbs. I ordered the regular length and was very happy I did. I wore heels and it was a perfect length. It fit well and was flattering.
bottom got a little wrinkled in shipment, but it was fine~

The dress fit like a glove and the pockets were such a fun addition. As others mentioned, the zipper is a bit difficult, but only at the waist where the material is thickest. The length was perfect--I wore 3.5 inch heels and someone thought I had the dress tailored for the shoes. I was absolutely heartbroken to return this dress because its the most beautiful thing I have ever worn. Would definitely rent this dress again!

Got this dress last minute.  Perfect length (maybe even a tad bit short).  Very slimming.  Did not hug at all. Had to pin the ruffle so it fell more attractively but besides that absolutely perfect.  Looked maturely sexy for a prom.  Would never be seen in the same dress twice, but might break that rule for this dress.

I loved this dress & received so many compliments on the color/fabric. Definitely need fashion tape to secure the top, but not a big deal. I read a lot of reviews & felt that it would fit my body well since I have a long torso. Because of this, I actually found the straps were short on me, which I think is the opposite of what others have felt.

This dress was SUPER comfortable. I rented it for a 1920's themed wedding and it was adorable. I received lots of compliments. It hit just below my knees and the movement of the dress was perfect. It definitely runs large so I would size down 1-2 sizes. Even the XS had room in the waist for me and I never wear XS.

This dress was perfect for my Friday night bridal shower. I loved the high neckline and full skirt. The fabric is thick and sturdy and has an embroidered pattern. It is also fairly shiny. So many compliments throughout the night, really loved this dress! Paired with an Ella Carter necklace and bright pink heels. Perfect!

The dress was flattering, a bit short for a wedding. Colors were great! It was definately unique and got lots of compliments. Rented both a 10 and a 12. Both fit but, wore the 12 because it was slightly longer. The dress was too short for church but was fine for the reception, just a little too short to dance in.
Super flattering!  Very cool cut!

Loved this - but could not wear it.  The chest size was too snug (I am a 36D) and the body was just a bit too short, so it was uncomfortable in the crotch area. I am 5'7.5" but I do have a long torso.
This dress is beautiful, however  I didn't wear it to the wedding.

neck is cut wide, so you may want to wear a strapless bra (see picture).  Cut out detail is less noticeable in person, but it does a good job of cinching your waist because it's a thicker fabric.  fabric has a sheen in person as well and is very stretchy.  I normally wear a small, but the x-small fit better.  A little long for my liking for my 5'6 frame, but it's easy to bunch up or roll under.

It seemed to run a little big but it worked well enough that I wore it to a wedding and still received a lot of compliments on it. I loved the pockets but must warn it gets hot when dancing a lot. I would have preferred the size down but still it was a good dress for the occasion.
Like many other comments, body of the dress runs true to size but sleeves are a bit snug.
VERY fitted. Difficult to fit Spanx and a strapless bra underneath.

I got many, many compliments on this dress. One person told me it "looked like it was made for me", so I was pretty happy with the choice! It was pretty comfortable and actually looked better without spanx because the material is pretty thick. I wasn't sure about the color as I had intially planned to wear it in dark green, but the blush was flattering enough on a lighter olive-based skin tone. The biggest con was that it seemed like A LOT of other people had enjoyed it as well. It was so stretched out that I couldn't tell a difference anywhere between the 2 and the 4 except right around the top of the bust when I zipped it. With that said, I didn't feel as bad about dragging the train over the dirty New Orleans French Quarter because even in 4inch heels, the regular definitely still swept the floor just like it was supposed to. :)

ETA: A rep at RTR got back to me and they “retired” my dress because of the stretching, so I would say it’s true to size now.

This dress zipped up, but was tight at the waist, so I didnt wear it because I have to sit a lot at work and didnt want to be uncomfortable. The sleeves were very billowy - I would be worried about getting them in food if you are not careful. Would be a great dress for an art gallery event, or other standing cocktail reception. I felt like this dress wore me, rather then me wearing the dress.

I rented this dress for a wedding I attended on Memorial Day weekend. The dress was very flattering but it is deep cut and did irritate my underarms a little while dancing. All in all this was a great dress. If you don't mind showing some cleavage GO FOR IT!!! The dress does have stretch and is cool.

I wore the 4P which was still a little long for me and I wore 5 inch platforms. I got compliments all night and couldn't be happier with the way it looked. My BFF also rented her dress which is pictured.
bottom of dress is offwhite brocade, very flippy and fun but pretty short
I would rent it again for cooler weather

Wore this to an industry event with skinny black jeans and ankle booties--got compliments all night. The fit was fabulous. I'm "hippy" so it can be tough to find blouses that don't pull, but this one was slimming and skimming in all the right places. It's a statement piece for sure, so keep the rest of the look simple.
loved the dress, received many complements. Will defiantly rent the runway for my next occasion!

Ok, now I usually fit into most things, even when they run small, but wow this runs small. And its too long for shorter ladies. Im 5 ft and this would look better if it were 6 inches shorter. Cool fabric and look but definitely not sized right nor meant for tiny ladies.

This dress was definitely true to size, plus the material is stretchy but still pretty thick, so it's very comfortable but still looks high quality. The color of this dress speaks for itself. It's in between a mint green and an emerald color- perfect for spring! I paired this with a neon pink statement necklace and nude pumps (Sorry for the messy room mirror pic-- I never get a good full body shot for these reviews) and got so many compliments from random strangers. I want to buy this dress and wear it everywhere!
longer than expected, very light weight ....narrow waist band..
The dress did scratch up my arms a little, but overall a very comfortable dress.

Not your typical LBD,  which was good, but did not WOW. the leather band at the waist made it a little confining and I had to size up to feel comfortable. This made the top gape at the arms. The material of the skirt was unexpected. It was comfortable to move around in, but looked a little less fine than I had expected. The zipper is really difficult. Don't rent if you plan on zipping this up without help.

Three words. RENT. THIS. DRESS. RTR sent it to me as an alternative when my original order was too damaged. There weren't any reviews online yet so I was a little nervous but felt alright considering they were also sending two other options. I didn't think id end up wearing this one but when I put it on I knew. I was BLOWN AWAY by how gorgeous it was. The tags were even still on! It felt and looked very rich and very beautiful. It's a piece of art, truly. I felt so beautiful in it, more beautiful than I've ever felt! The photo on the website doesn't do it justice at all. The lace is actually gold with a lot of glittery shimmer to it, while the under layer is emerald, not the bluish it appears online. The lace is wonderful. Very delicate and breathtaking. I got a ridiculous amount of compliments from people I didn't even know at the wedding! The fit is great, with a very classic silhouette. It's also very light and breathable.  I did have to take smaller steps in it, and made my usual dancing a little difficult, but it was worth it! If you get the chance to rent this dress, you must!

This dress was so pretty. Very classic, but the ruffles at the bottom are a nice fun touch. I wore this dress to work and it was very comfortable. It definitely hugs the body so I wore a slip to hide panty lines.
Sleeves are slightly tight, sequins were a little itchy and I had to pin it to make it shorter. Overall, I felt fabulous and would rent this dress again!
The color is definitely a maroon and not red like in the picture but it fit wonderfully, had pockets, and the material was heavy so even though it was sleeveless it worked for a fall wedding.
Fit perfectly. Elegant and classy

I wore this dress to a rustic chic wedding at the venue. The dress is beautiful but more of a yellow/gold in person, and the color is still gorgeous. It photographs so well, and I got so many compliments! The yellow looked so great with my skin tone too. I wore a strapless, backless bra with this dress because the back is low. I had to keep lifting the bodice, as per usual with strapless dresses. The back got caught in my shoes once or twice when I was out on the dance floor, but nothing too terrible. I would definitely recommend this dress.

The dress fits very slim through the waist and hips. I ordered a 6 with an 8 backup. If I wanted to wear spanx, I would have stuck with the 6, but it was pretty warm so I went up to the 8. I was told it looked like the dress was made for me and received comments all night. The peach/pink color looks great on even lighter skinned tones. Looooooved this dress!
I definitely needed the long and it worked well with a moderate heel.  A wee bit snug in the waist for me, but a perfect fit in the hips and bust.
Just the right length...anything shorter would have been too short for my height. Nice dress.

I rented this as a backup for my friend's wedding. Although I didn't end up wearing this it was a tough choice cause the fit of both dresses was great. I actually rented a size 14 and it fit great even with my large bust. The other dress won out because it had pockets. I will probably rent this for my next event.
Great with sandals or dressy sling backs.  Loved it!

I loved this sweater.  It's definitely a little kooky, but the weight is good and it goes with just about anything.  I wore this on the weekend with jeans and black boots and to work with black pants and heels and I received several compliments.  Would rent again.

This dress was incredible - seriously my favorite thing I have ever worn.  The color is a vibrant red and the cut of the top is extremely flattering.  I wore spanx underneath to smooth out lines and wrinkles, however the dress was so comfortable I wasn't worried about eating or drinking too much in it.  Also, the length was perfect with 4" heels.  Love this dress and would absolutely rent it again for another event!

This dress is beautiful. I wore it to multiple occasions and received tons of compliments on the unique cut and the gorgeous colors. I wasn't ready to send it back and then I realized, I have unlimited...I can order it again! I would highly recommend this dress for all shapes and sizes.

Man oh man, complements galore!  I got so many complements wearing this jacket that it started to get a little embarrassing :).  Just know, this jacket runs small, but I made it work.   I rented the large; even if there was an extra large option, I don't think a larger size would make up for the proportions of the jacket.  Four stars for the sheer awesomeness of this piece, minus one star for sizing.

Not understated but still very elegant. Fit like a glove, and was sexy without being over the top - I was able to wear it to a religiously conservative wedding and didn't feel uncomfortable. Comfortable too! Hope to have a chance to wear it again.

I did not like the fit of this dress.  I do not have a large chest (strike one - you need it here) and I am not a size 0 (which is required to look good in this dress).  I did not wear this and do not recommend it - on the model it looks great but that is about it.  By the way, I am 5'6", 124 pounds and normally a size 4 or 6.  I have a mostly flat stomach but even the slightest pouch will be noticed in this dress.  Sorry!  Wish I had better news...even my husband asked that I didn't wear this dress and he likes bling!
No complaints..great dress!

This dress is beautiful in person. It's very unique and photographs well.  It fits well around the ribcage and highlights your waist nicely. 
The embroidery is nice and heavy so it won't get damaged easily. The top of the dress has an inner zipper and structure so it does not slip at all. 
The long length is LONG. I'm 5'7", and even standing way up on my tip toes the dress was at least 3" too long. Since the embroidery on the bottom is so thick, you can't use hem tape to shorten it. So unless you're super tall and wearing stilettos, get the regular length.
Like other reviews noted, it ran a little shorter than I would have thought. The size 0 fit but I worn the size 2 for the length.

The dress was a beautiful, royal blue. The back was my absolute favorite part - modest, but sexy. The lace, however, was very worn and was actually torn near the bottom of the dress. I would've exchanged it for another if I hadn't received it the day of the event. Overall, it's a wonderful dress but RTR needs to retire the specific one I received.

This dress is very flattering for an hourglass shape. It has a reasonable amount of give in the thigh/hip area as well as in the arms. It actually fell right at the knee on me and I am 5'8 so that is something to consider if you are on the shorter side.

I thought it was a great dress for a last-minute Black & White affair.  Looks like it's two pieces, but it's not.  It was super comfy.  The zipper got stuck and I needed help getting into the dress, but it was perfect after.

On the 12R I rented as a backup, the decorative bow on the front was not secured properly and was just flopping around.  I was glad the 10R fit or I would have had to break out the needle & thread.

This wasn't my first time renting but the first time I had a snafu-One that was handled perfectly. UPS misplaced the dress and it wasn't going to get to me until after my flight had left. I IM'd rent the runway and they had the same dress shipped next day to the hotel were we would be staying. Instead of receiving the dress on Thursday and flying up with it Friday I simply received it at the hotel Friday. Its always nice to find out how a company deals with issues and they couldn't have handled this any better.  I was a fan before and now I'm a crazed fan. The dress itself was exactly what I was looking for. Comfortable enough to eat a big meal and then sit through a broadway show but still looked incredible.

I wore this dress to a friend's 1060s/Mad Men themed New Years party. It was perfect for the occasion! I got tons of compliments. I can usually wear a 4, but this was a bit small on me. Sometimes I'll go up to a 6, but I ordered too close to New Years and the 6's were already gone. It wasn't too bad, just a bit snug. 
The zipper doesn't have a clasp at the top, so the dress would come unzipped a bit every now and then. But I asked my friends to keep an eye on it for me, and it was fine.
All in all, I loved it!

The lace on this dress is beautiful, and it fit, but the stomach area is very unforgiving. If I had a support system underneath maybe it wouldn't have mattered. I think this dress would look perfect on a size 8 or below. Sorry, no picture

This dress will go down as one of my absolute favorites. It is perfectly angelic and fashion forward. Running true to size, we recommend sizing up for backup. With no stretch in the fabric and a tighter fit in the bust, this piece works best for smaller cup sizes and may be worn with no bra. It is very fitted at the waist with comfortable room throughout the midsection. Although this piece is a full skirt, because of the fitted underneath slip, curvier women may want to consider sizing up for their primary size. At 5’5, the hemline reached my knees. Pair with black strappy heels and minimal jewelry to your wedding or night to event.

I wore this dress for a bachelorette party and I received many compliments. The material is super comfortable. I did feel warm with the long sleeves and had to use fabric tape on the V neck line, but other than that I loved this dress. I wish I could own it!

loved this dress -- i received many compliments on it. both the 8 and 10 fit but i wore the 10 for a little extra length.  i just wish i had gotten the long version because it was a little short with my shoes on.

The size 4 was too tight in the bust so I ended up wearing a 6.  The 6 was a little too loose in the waist but this is not an uncommon problem with an hourglass shape.  The sheer back is beautiful and it was really comfortable.  No spanxs necessary!

I was worried about a bra but I did not end up needing one with the dress (I'm a 32D). HARD to zip up!! After a brief momentary crisis I realized the zipper was simply hard to zip and it was not related to the dress not fitting appropriately. I ordered a size 2 and size 4. The size 2 had a shorter torso (I am 5'8)  and I preferred the size 4 length but the size 4 was too large in the bust.
Great fit. Skirt is poufy, so that's fun!

This dress is less structured than it may appear in the picture. I gave 3 stars because I had trouble with the sleeves/shoulders being too loose (and if they fall off, the whole front falls off!). I tried fashion tape, but it didn't work too effectively. I just had to be a little more careful in my movements. I'm 5'3" and small-chested, so I thought this dress was comfortable (and comfortably short). One great thing about this dress is that it packs very easily. I had to put it in a suitcase to travel to the wedding and it came out without any wrinkles. Not too much stretch or give, just a little bit. Quite sparkly in brighter lighting.
If it was not so expensive, I would buy this blazer for a permanent installation in my closet

Beautiful dress - THERE IS A SIDE ZIPPER - for everyone saying how difficult it was to put the dress on - unzip it that will help :) 

I went with the large instead of the medium as the medium was a teensy bit too tight, and shouldn't have. The large was way too big and i realized that too late as i spent the night pulling up the shoulders to cover my brastraps and pulling it down in the back to cover up too much cleavage. 

Wore it to a winter black tie wedding

This is a lovely dress for a black tie event.  I wore it to an event that had about 250 people there and three ladies separately told me that I had the best dress of the evening!  Fits really nicely and the sequins are really pretty.  Comfortable for moving around and dancing, too.

I got a ton of compliments, the only reason not to buy it is that it is unforgettable, once worn. 
This is the best dress I have rented, the 2 previous ones were great, but this is a prize.

This dress is easy to wear, fitting fairly loose. It is a bit on the shorter side, I'm 5'6" and it hit about 6" above the knee, but with tights it was demure enough for work. I enjoyed wearing it, felt put together without much effort.
Fits true to size. Dress was a little above my knee.
This ran rather large and a little long/oversized for my height but loved the comfort and the unique details.
Like the prior reviews this was super tight at the rib cage area. I ended up wearing it as open back as the next size up would have been too big in the hips. Still stunning and got many compliments.

The dress fits true to size. I had a 6 as a back up just in case, but you wont need to size up. I am a little short and maybe the dress could've looked a little more flattering if I was 5'5". Very comfortable, stylish, a little sexy but polished and professional which was perfect for my formal work awards ceremony.

This dress was incredible.  I typically wear a size 2 in RTR but I was about 6 months post partum and breastfeeding so I wore the size 4 which fit snugly.  As you can see, the girls were on full display, which wasn't necessarily a bad thing! I did not need a bra- the dress was supportive enough without one.  I received compliments upon compliments- someone actually thought the dress was made specifically for me.  Pros: snug and poured into feel, pockets, peek-a-boo sides.  Possible cons: lots of emphasis on the bust (but keep in mind I was breastfeeding so they were much larger than normal) the peek-a-boo sides made it difficult to hide the hanger ribbons (not that much of a con, I have to say!).  The dress was  a little longer than I thought it would be but I am 5'5" so it looked fine to me.  I think it might swallow up a shorter frame.  All in all, I loved it and it was perfect for the occasion.

I tried on both the large and medium and they both fit fine but I chose to go with the medium since I wanted the additional support. The dress looked just like the pictures and I received compliments all night long especially when people got to see the back of the dress. Because the dress is covered in sequins it was a little heavy and the sequins were super scratchy under my arms and the zipper was a little tricky but after working if for a little bit it worked just fine. I wanted something that would be more of a surprise then the traditional red for a holiday party and this dress certainly ticked off all of my must haves on the wish list. The dress was brand new and had the tags still attached when it arrived.
This skirt fits very true to size, but is extremely stretchy. Super cute for work or a night out. Definitely recommend.

i'm typically a 4, but read reviews and went up to a 6, shldve stuck w the 4. i'm chesty and have a larger waist, but there is stretch at the waist and there was more of a gap in the chest area in the 6, the 4 wldve been great. hit a bit above the ankles so looks best in heels at my height. the pattern is perfect for spring/summer. loved the cross back and subtle ruffles. i don't want to give this back!! do NOT hesitate to rent this!!

I rented this dress for a graduation party, and I was expecting the weather to be a little chilly. However, it was about 80 degrees, and this dress has such thick fabric I wasn't able to wear it. The color is beautiful and it's not too short. I have a small chest, so it was a bit roomy there for me. I'd rent again when I know the weather is definitely going to be cold!

the color is AMAZING!!! i'm typically btwn 2 and 4, 2 fit with room to spare. a touch long, but i was still able to wear w flats, would be better w heels. short gals rejoice, this is a jumper for you! the elastic waist gives you shape and the zipper in the front makes it the easiest bathroom experience i've ever had w a jumpsuit. i opted to wear a sports bra underneath since the front gaped a little, not sure if it's a sizing issue, but i thought it was part of the look and it didn't bother me.  i cannot say enough about how great this is! do not hesitate to rent!!!
I loved this dress. I have a booty, it hugged nicely, but the nude color looked a little green on me. It didn't match my shoes. But the fit and feel of this dress was amazing.

At a wedding where most other women were wearing black or navy, I stood out in gold sequins. Normally, I don't like to draw that much attention to myself, but I risked it because I love how this dress was elegant, tasteful, and unusual both because of the color and the stunning, low back. I felt very comfortable in it and received compliments all night (and the next night when I showed other friends my photos). I had no trouble dancing in this dress. My four inch heels were perfect. I wore a bra with no back that just had adhesive to stick to my sides. I would love to have another occasion to rent this dress again.

I think I’m ready for Winter! This is such a chic jacket; I love it. It’s over-sized with a sleek design that is appropriate for any look that you’re going for. I love over-sized items so I would honestly wear this with almost anything. It runs true to size and is perfect for any cup size; the exaggerated collar has a lot of fabric and even a hood  that is not only trendy but super comfortable. There’s enough room in the coat to wear a sweater and layer up if need be; it’s the perfect go-to winter staple!
This was my first dress from rent the runway and I absolutely loved it! It fit perfectly and I got so many compliments!
fit well but def a little on the shorter side. Nice and thick so it gave you a nice figure. Would def recommend it.

I am in love with this top/skirt combo.  I ordered a 6 in the top & I'm glad I did. It fits very tight so I went without a bra. The fabric is very heavy, so I was extremely hot during a hot outdoor summer wedding. Overall, I really loved the outfit & wish I could have kept it. I received so many compliments all night for how unique and fun the outfit was. Love!
The top was baggy, but the bum was tight. Not a surprise given my body type, but I wanted to try a jumpsuit anyways.

The dress looked wonderful! I got a ton of compliments and at least three people said I looked like a super model in it. It did fit very snug. It was not uncomfortable, but when I lifted my arms above my head it was very tight and would push the flesh together around my shoulders and make rolls - which didn't really matter at the baby shower but if you are shopping for an event where there may be dancing this dress may be a little tight for the occasion. The fabric is also very thick - which was perfect for the chilly day I wore it on and the calm demeanor of the event, but at one moment when we first got in the car it was warm and since the dress is thick and tight I felt a little dizzy. So this dress is perfect for a cool day - not at all good for summer or an event where you'll be moving a lot and sweating.

I would be sure to plan on wearing jewelry with this dress. In my opinion it looks a little better with a necklace, bracelet, and earrings. I wore this with white heels. Underwear was not an issue - I wore a normal bra and just chose thin white panties to reduce the appearance of lines. 

The dress really does have quite a bit of mint green in it. Everyone has mentioned that in the comments but I had a hard time imagining it since it doesn't show in the pictures. It does look pretty - but it is kinda funny how that doesn't show up at all in any of the pictures.
The dress fit perfectly, my husband loved it! Great for a date night.

This is a gorgeous dress.  It is very form fitted through the hips.  I wore it to a black tie event and got so many compliments - from both men and women. The fabric is quite thick so it made it more forgiving for the bumps we don't want to show.  Did not need spanx because the material was so stretchy/compressing.  I was too self conscious in the first size I ordered and after chatting online with customer service, they overnighted me the 12R.  I was very impressed with the dress, the shipping, the convenience and the customer service.

I'm 126 lbs, 5-8 and I like that this was knee-length and long enough to be appropriate for someone with long legs where everything looks too short on me. I wore with a nude heel and gold jewelry/accessories. I also wore with a Venus strapless bra that's transparent on the sides so that it didn't show through the cutouts.

I'm normally a size 4 and slightly bottom-heavy, so was concerned that a 2 would be too tight in the hips but that a 4 might be 2 tight in the bust, but it was all-around a perfect fit wearing a size 2.

LOVE the fit, the material is like wearing a scuba suit. It's weird at first but it sort of works like you have a shaper all over your body.
I wore for work which is television and just loved it.
A little tight around the armpits but that could just be me other than that the dress is a lovely shape and I enjoyed wearing it (:
It was a beautiful and comfortable dress!  Many compliments throughout the night!

I ordered the 8 and 10, unsure of how tight the bust would be. Without a doubt, the 8 was the way to go, and the "fitted" look is how the dress is meant to be worn. I was comfortable the entire night, and the dress suited the venue perfectly. Rent this!

Fit was tight on top (fits like a corset and there's no flexibility) so size up if you are in between. Love the hi-low style. Waist is also slanted (which is cool) but I hid that with a belt anyway. Dressed it down with some blush flats
Cute dress, fits well. Not necessarily a showstopper but fun. The colors are pretty muted which was unexpected. Glammed it up with some Louboutins.

Adored this feminine dress with the edgy detail of black mesh piping at the bottom of the silhouette.  Very comfortable to wear and as a woman who is 5'10", the length was perfection for the classy party.
A bit short on me, but I'm 5'11".  Sooo cute.
This romper was so cute and comfortabel! The shorts are a great fit even if you have bigger thighs and the waist band makes it easy to blouse it up or down to fit your body. Highly recomend it!

I wore this dress to a black tie birthday party at the Plaza. The dress was definitely nice enough for the event and felt fun and age appropriate because of the cute cut outs on the sides. Loved the dress!
The boning inside is not very comfortable. Wore with a tee shirt underneath.
The arms are pretty snug, but the rest fits beautifully.

I wore this dress for my rehearsal dinner and received tons of compliments! It was a beautiful dress. The length was better when I wore 3-inch heels (I am 5'5"), but it worked alright with flats as well. Caution: wear with a slip! It was very windy for our rehearsal, and my dress was flying all over the place. People definitely saw my slip when the dress was blowing around, so if that is something that bothers you, don't wear this dress in the wind. I would recommend a slip regardless. 

Leave time for ironing/steaming the dress, and if you can, use steam or get it pressed. It arrived wrinkled and I had a really hard time removing the wrinkles without steam. I have a short torso, so I felt like I had to keep an eye on how the dress was laying in that area. Regardless, I would purchase this dress in a heartbeat if I could find it!
Will definitely be renting this one again! Yeah, you should probably wear it without a bra, but a nude bra won't turn any heads and will make the look even more comfortable.
It was a little smaller through the bust and shorter than I expected. The next size up fit perfectly. The detail on the bottom is fun and flirty and the dress was perfect for dancing all night!

I love the look, fit and softness of this blazer. I wore it to work and to my son's basketball banquet that same day, so it's a perfect day to night piece to have in your closet. I had such a long day that day, that I forgot to take a pic with it on, but I will be renting it again and will most likely purchase it.

I loved this dress and got many compliments. It fits like a glove so if you want it a little looser I would order a size up for the second dress. I've dubbed this dress the wetsuit dress. The material feels luxurious and is amazing. This dress hugs the body but was comfortable to walk, dance and sit in. I'm tall and the length was perfect. It did ride up a little when I walked and danced. I would totally wear this dress again.

I am currently in between 12 and 14 sizes so 12 was a little tighter but 14 was a little big on me in the waist but left room for dancing comfortably and LOTS of food at the wedding. Glad I chose to wear the 14.
I would recommend sizing up for the backup size, but the size S worked out well for me! Lots of compliments all night. I got away with wearing a normal bra, but it looks great without one too.

Every person I spoke to complimented this shirt when I wore it. It's comfortable, easy to wear/flattering, and has just enough edge.  The only con is that the shoulders/chest is quite narrow.  I had a hard time keeping bra straps in. A racer back bra probably would have worked. Despite that though, I love it and will rent it again!
Form fitting/flattering.  Perfect length and I am 5'7.5" Somewhat tight in the chest, but this was flattering.  Loved loved loved how this dress fit!!!

I got this to wear when I went home over the holidays and wanted something a little funky.  I wore a size Small with skinny black jeans and thought it looked pretty good open or closed.  When it was worn open, I did think I looked a little heavier because it is an asymmetrical zip and therefore there is a lot of fabric in the front, but generally it was pretty cute!

I normally wear a size 0/2 in dresses. The size 2 was falling off and the size 0 was also far too big. The dress is gorgeous though and I was definitely disappointed. The RTR store was very helpful but I was just disappointed I couldn't wear the dress.

This dress fit perfectly and true to size. Both the 4 and the 2 fit, but ended up wearing the 4 for the night. The 2 did fit but was just more form fitting. Wanted to be comfortable and be able to dance at the wedding.

The dress is gorgeous! Really intricate sequins makes this dress shine. The open back is really pretty and compliments the conservative front. Love the sheer shoulders and side panels. I am 5'6 and wore heels with it. It hits right above the knee... Perfect for a formal event. The bottom of the dress does not have a lot of give to it, so it is hard to bend down and pick things up or even put your shoes on once in it. I did wear a backless bra with it.

Got compliments all night long (from ladies and gentlemen). Really a classy dress and perfect for a black tie optional, wedding, party, New Years, etc.

5'4", 118 lbs, 34-26-36. I wore a size 0.  I have a relatively small bust (34B), but if I was more busty, I would have definitely gone up a size.  The dress hit right at my knee.  The dress fabric was relatively thick, but forgiving.  Was not as tight as a body con dress, which was nice.  Overall a great dress!
Fabric was thick enough that I didn't need a bra. Did need 3" heels so it didn't drag on ground.

I had so many people compliment me on my dress. I felt more beautiful than the bride! Wonderful tight fit up top, it held up to the four hour reception full of dancing. I would love to rent this again.

Super cute summer top! I love how breezy it is! The fabric and print are great which makes it the perfect summer top! There is a back buckle in the inside of it to make it fit your body perfectly. I thought it was weird at first, but I buckled it loosely and it didn’t bother me at all.  Running true to size, I would recommend sizing up for backup. I would also suggest using a strapless, NuBra, or no bra. Pair this with some white or blue skirt or shorts, sandals or espadrilles and you will rock your OOTD!
It gets attention, but is conservative enough for work.
What a beautiful Hollywood dress.

I wore this dress to a baptism and it was perfect! I loved this plum color it went with my light skin tone. I usually go back and forth between size 0-2 depending on how it fits my bust. I have a pretty narrow rib cage and the size 0 fit perfectly without being too tight for my chest. I have pretty small biceps and the sleeves were pretty tight and not very flexible; therefore, I did not have a full range of motion for my arms. That didn't impact me enough, as I wore the dress anyways.

I'm 5'8" and wore it with 2 inch heels, if I had wanted to wear higher heels I would've gotten a Long. Fabric was very nice, dress in wonderful condition. It hugged me in all the right places and was turning heads all night. I loved the back! :)
Love, love, LOVE this dress. I have a larger chest and normally fluctuate between a size 4 and 6. The size 4 fit like a glove! Would absolutely use RTR again.
madly in love with this dress. I wore it to work and to a wedding. fits great, fabric is nice. the color blocking is awesome and great colors.

It fit perfectly, and true to size. The top enhanced my chest, but not in a an over the top way! It was a flowy material that I felt great it. I wish it came in other colors so I could wear it again to other weddings.

I rented this dress for a wedding; when it arrived I gasped when I saw the color and lace in person! It is a beautiful, eye-catching dress. It was just slightly too big for me in the waist area; if it came in a size 0, that probably would have fit me better. However, I wore it anyway because I loved the teal color and lace details! Guests were coming up to me all night to ask where I got it. I was really sad to mail it back!

Wore this dress for New Years and got really nice compliments from friends and strangers alike!

As others have mentioned, the zipper was difficult to manage, so I ended up wearing the bigger size for comfort around my rib cage, but that did mean the dress hit a little lower than I would have liked, almost past my knee.

Also, I recommend ordering two sizes even if you're positive you only need one, because my two sizes were different colors! The sequins on the 6 had more of a pink hue, and the ones on the 8 were more gold. Definitely a comfortable dress to spend a long night in, had no issues with the sequins scratching or falling off.
I can't tell you the last time I wore a 4 in anything, but even the 4 was a little big. Size down - it is a great, comfy dress! Very bright and perfect for Spring and Summer.
The dress fit great and I got a ton of compliments. A big pro was it was comfortable to dance in the whole night.

The dress was beautiful. The colors were vibrant and the back of the dress was sophisticated sexy.  I loved the look. Walking around the city, the dress did ride up a bit, but overall, I'd definitely recommend it (especially if you're looking to stand out).

Was a little too big in the chest and a little too long.  I wouldn't have bought it because the fit wasn't that great, but was good enough to wear and I don't think anyone really noticed.  Overall a fun dress!  Perhaps better for winter/fall due to the thick fabric.  A little shinier than I expected.

As others have said, it definitely is a bit snug in the arms.  Order a size up if you're really wanting to get more room through there.  I thought this dress ran a bit small; I'm usually a 2-4 in dresses, and the 6 probably would have been a bit better, though I made the 4 work.  The color is pretty true to the photos online, which I loved! Also, a helpful tip - make sure you have someone around to help zip the dress all the way up! It was tricky to reach all the way around, especially with the arms being a bit tight. I loved it though - and it has pockets!!
Fits true to size, so flattering! I got compliments all night. However be warned, you need a buddy to help you zip it up--zipper gets stuck very easily!!
very comfortable, flattering for the figure.
no cons!

I ended up not wearing this dress and instead wore my backup dress to a black tie wedding. It's a very pretty dress and surprisingly comfortable. You can wear a regular bra and panties and it's forgiving in the tummy area because of the draping. I didn't wear it because it was long and I was worried about snagging or tripping. I'm 5'3" and the regular size was all that was available. Per some reviews I thought I'd be fine but even in my 5 inch platforms it was a bit too long. It's a great party dress though!
Beautiful feminine dress.  Lace was lovely. Easy to wear. Fun bottom!
I should have ordered long.  Dress was about an inch and a half off the floor when I wore 3 inch heels.  Other than that I loved the dress. It was very comfortable to wear.
The only thing about the dress is I would not suggest you have long hair. My hair constantly got stuck on the dress.

This dress was great, I ordered a 2 and a 4 - the size 2 fit perfectly. I am 5'8 and often times have a hard time with length...no trouble here. Fit perfect with tall (very) heels. It was pretty scratchy under your arms, but so worth it...got lots of looks!
True to size, comfortable fit, nice material.
I received so many compliments. It arrived on time and I liked that I had another size option. Everyone was commenting on it before during and after my brother's wedding. I cant wait to rent again.

This dress is very cute and playful, but the skirt was just too poofy for my tastes, so I ended up wearing a backup dress instead.  I have a small chest and upper body, and the size 2 was definitely too big -- if you're small up top I recommend sizing down. You won't have to worry about the skirt being too snug!
